title.value: Improving the accuracy of single-trial fMRI response estimates using GLMsingle
title.justification: The title of the paper as provided in the document header and abstract, which describes the primary focus of the research presented.
title.quote: Improving the accuracy of single-­trial fMRI response estimates using GLMsingle

extractions.description: The paper presents GLMsingle, a toolbox designed to enhance the accuracy of single-trial fMRI response estimates. It integrates techniques for improving general linear model (GLM) beta estimates, such as custom hemodynamic response function (HRF) fitting, noise regression through cross-validation, and beta regularization via ridge regression. The paper demonstrates the toolbox's effectiveness using the Natural Scenes Dataset, BOLD5000, and StudyForrest auditory dataset, showcasing its potential for broader applications in cognitive and systems neuroscience.

type.justification: The paper performs experiments using the GLMsingle toolbox on datasets like the Natural Scenes Dataset and BOLD5000, providing practical validation of its effectiveness in improving fMRI response estimates.
type.quote: We demonstrate that GLMsingle: (i) helps decorrelate response estimates between trials nearby in time; (ii) enhances representational similarity between subjects within and across datasets; and (iii) boosts one-­versus-­many decoding of visual stimuli.

name.justification: The paper focuses on improving techniques for analyzing fMRI data, which is a key concern in neuroscience, particularly in studying brain responses to various stimuli.
name.quote: This important work provides the field of human neuroimaging with a new method to estimate single-­trial fMRI responses.

name.justification: The paper is specifically focused on techniques to improve fMRI data analysis, which is crucial for gaining insights into brain functions through imaging.
name.quote: Because such experiments necessarily involve brief stimulus durations and few repetitions of each stimulus, achieving sufficient signal-­to-­noise ratio can be a major challenge.

name.justification: GLMsingle is the main model/tool introduced by the paper, aimed at improving single-trial fMRI response estimates.
name.quote: We introduce GLMsingle, a scalable, user-­friendly toolbox available in MATLAB and Python that enables accurate estimation of single-­trial fMRI responses.

is_contributed.justification: The paper presents GLMsingle as a novel contribution to improving fMRI response estimates.
is_contributed.quote: We introduce GLMsingle, a scalable, user-­friendly toolbox available in MATLAB and Python.

is_executed.justification: GLMsingle was applied to several datasets as part of the empirical analysis in the paper.
is_executed.quote: Applying GLMsingle to the Natural Scenes Dataset and BOLD5000, we find that GLMsingle substantially improves the reliability of beta estimates.

is_compared.justification: The effectiveness of GLMsingle is demonstrated by comparisons with baseline and LSS approaches to estimate improvements in beta reliability and other metrics.
is_compared.quote: We directly compared the ‍ b 1 ‍ and ‍ b 4 ‍ beta versions for each subject within a liberal mask of visual cortex ... finding widespread increases in reliability when comparing GLMsingle to baseline.
